premise: The v-t graph shows two lines representing the velocities of Cars A and B.
conclusion: Car A has a constant velocity of 40 m/s from t = 10 s to t = 30 s.
Car B accelerates uniformly from t = 0 s to t = 30 s.
The area under the v-t graph represents the displacement.
The two cars are side by side at t = 30 s.
The two cars are also side by side at t = 10 s.
The farthest distance between the cars occurs when their speeds are equal, which is at t = 20 s.
At t = 10 s, the displacement of Car A is x1 = 40 * 10 m = 400 m.
The displacement of Car B at t = 10 s is x2 = 1/2 * (20 + 40) * 10 m = 300 m.
The maximum distance between the two cars is Î”x = 400 m - 300 m = 100 m.
